title: Senior executing manager
description:
At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests, and you’ll make sure that message comes across loud and clear. Partnering closely with Vanguard executives, you will help bring their voices to clients and crew. Reporting to the Head of Executive & Internal Communications, you will serve as the authority on executive communications and lead the team that develops and executes comprehensive communications strategies aligned to business needs and objectives.

 

Day to day responsibilities:

  • Work with Vanguard executives to develop integrated communications strategies that articulate Vanguard’s value to key audiences. Provide executive-level communications counsel and coaching.
  • Produce high-quality, integrated communications materials across a variety of formats, platforms, and channels including speeches, talking points, thought leadership, bylines, and social media posts.
  • Partner with Public Relations, Internal Communications, and Strategic Communications teams to identify media opportunities, external speaking engagements, and thought leadership content that support core messaging platforms.
  • Develop and strengthen working relationships with key influencers and executives across the organization and in the industry to support communications and business objectives.
  • Manage and develop a small team of writers and graphic designers in pursuit of the group’s overall objectives.
  • Spearhead continuous improvement in executives’ communications. Measure and monitor alignment and impact.
  • Participate in special projects and perform other duties as assigned.

 

The ideal candidate is a highly motivated communications manager that possess sound judgement and expert writing skills. Ideal qualifications include:

  • Ten plus years related work experience; supervisory experience required; experience in asset management, finance, economics or related field strongly preferred
  • Experience building relationships and working with senior executives
  • Speechwriting experience; ability to write in the voice of a principal, including communication style and preferences in terms of form and content
  • Ability to work independently on short timelines and translate complex, technical and policy initiatives into simple and effective communications
  • Ability to set an agenda that is tied to business objectives and measure impact
  • Strong leadership skills and ability to mobilize and develop others
  • Is an advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion

 

Core Responsibilities

1. Hires, evaluates, and supervises crew. Provides guidance and training as necessary to develop crew. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, and makes informed compensation decisions in accordance with all applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.

2. Develops communications strategy to enable strategic business outcomes. Leads the communication development, operation, delivery, and measurement across a variety of business needs.

3. Protects Vanguard's reputation through all communications across various channels and platforms. Leads communication consultants to proactively source and deliver business-critical communications.

4. Drives the development of communication agendas with high-quality communications material across a variety of formats, platforms and channels.

5. Drives the impact of the collective communication strategy. Ensures the execution of all phases of the communications process, including conception, implementation, and measurement. Partners closely with senior leaders to advise and develop communications strategies that meet current and future needs of Vanguard.

6. Balances external practice with internal brand. Serve as Vanguard's authority on industry best practices, emerging trends, and their validity in Vanguard's environment and culture to encourage adoption as appropriate.

7. Develops and strengthens working relationships with key influencers and executives across the organization and in the industry to support communications and business objectives.

8. Spearheads continuous improvements in Vanguard's communication strategy and implementation. Measures and monitors client satisfaction and makes recommendations based on feedback gathered from various sources.

9. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

  • Eight years related work experience, Five years Communications experience preferred. Supervisory experience preferred.

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.

 

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

 

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

 

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

 

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

 

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

 

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

 

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

 

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

 

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

 

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

 

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

 

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.
